Instrument_PDS3.instrument_name: CASSEGRAIN FOCUS DIRECT IMAGE CCD CAMERA
Instrument_PDS3.instrument_desc:
Instrument Overview =================== The Cassegrain focus CCD imaging system is a mobile system that can be moved between telescopes or foci of the same telescope. Various CCDs may be used for imaging, operated via an ARCON controller, depending on the telescope and focus to be used. The CCDs are mounted in nitrogen- filled dewars.
A User Manual for the CTIO CFCCD is available from the CTIO web site at this URL:
http://www.ctio.noao.edu/cfccd/cfccd.html
Detectors ========= Several CCD detectors are available for use, depending on telescope chosen, observing schedule and the type of observation to be made. The list of currently available detectors and their characteristics can be found at the web site mentioned above.
Filters ======= Two filter wheels are provided, each of which can hold up to seven 3- inch square filters. These may be swapped out for a single five- position wheel holding 4-inch square filters. The list of filters available at the observatory is available at the CTIO web site:
http://www.ctio.noao.edu/
